array.string: First man-made object to reach space: the A4-rocket from Germany
V-2/WAC-Corporal first American rocket to outer space.
The first orbital launch was of the Soviet unmanned Sputnik 1 mission
USSR launches Sputnik 2 carrying the dog Laika: the first animal in orbit
Luna 1 becomes the first spacecraft to reach the vicinity of the Moon.
The first color photograph of Earth is received from outer space.
Yuri Gagarin becomes the first man to fly in space.
Mercury: Alan Shepard is the first American into space, a flight of 15 minutes.
First orbital flight for the USA when John Glenn orbited Earth.
NASA's Mariner 2 becomes the first spacecraft to fly by Venus.
Gordon Cooper, the first American to spend more than a day in space.
Soviet Union: Valentina Tereshkova becomes the first woman in space.
Soviet Union: Voskhod 1 is first spacecraft with a multi-person crew.
Aleksei Leonov, becomes the first person to walk in space: 2 for 12 minutes.
NASA launches Gemini 3, the United States' first two-man space flight.
Launch of Gemini 4, the first multi-day space mission by an NASA crew.
France launches first satellite: A1-capsule , becoming third nation in space.
USSR’s Luna 9 makes the first controlled rocket-assisted landing on the Moon.
USSR space probe crashes on Venus: the first spacecraft to land on another planet.
The USA launches Gemini 8: first space docking with the Agena Target Vehicle.
USSR launches Luna 10 the first spaceprobe to enter orbit around the Moon.
Surveyor 1 lands on the Moon: the first US spacecraft to land on another world.
Vladimir M Komarov s first to die in space, aboard Soyuz 1 at age 40.
Venera 4 is launched: the first to enter the knother planet atmosphere and return data
USSR launches Zond 5: first to fly around the Moon and re-enter the Earth's atmosphere.
Apollo 10 transmits first color pictures of Earth from space.
Apollo 11 is launched the first manned space mission to land on the moon.
Venera 7 is the first spacecraft transmit data from the surface of another planet, Venus.
USSR lands Lunokhod 1 on the Moon, the first roving robot to land on another world.
Soviet Venera 7 is first spacecraft to land on another planet (Venus).
Launch of Salyut 1, first human-made space station.
US launches first satellite into lunar orbit from manned spacecraft.
The American space probe, Mariner 9: first spacecraft to orbit another planet Mars
Skylab, USA’s first space station, is launched.
NASA launches the Mariner 10 the first space probe to reach Mercury.
An Apollo and Soyuz spacecraft dock with each other first link-up between nations
The Viking 2 lands on Mars and takes the first color photos of the planet's surface.
US Voyager I takes the first space photograph of the Earth and Moon together.
Soyuz 27 links with Salyut 6 and Soyuz 26 (first time three spacecraft link).
The first space shuttle orbiter, Columbia, is delivered to the John F. Kennedy Space Center.
Pioneer 11 becomes the first spacecraft to visit Saturne,.
Voyager I makes its closest approach to Saturn, when it flies within 77,000 miles.
Space Shuttle astronauts perform the first space shuttle spacewalk for 4 hours, 10 min.
Space Shuttle Astronaut Sally Ride becomes the first American woman in space.
Astronauts from Space Shuttle Challenger make first untethered spacewalk.
Salyut 7: Svetlana Savitskaya becomes the first woman to perform a space walk.
Space shuttle astronauts snare a satellite; first space salvage.
Challenger breaks apart 73 seconds after liftoff: all seven astronauts died.
Hubble Space Telescope sends first photographs from space.
The American Galileo spacecraft is the first probe to visit an asteroid.
Three astronauts simultaneous walk in space for the first time.
Cosmonaut Valeri Polyakov returns after setting a record for 438 days in space
Norman Thagard is the first American to ride into space aboard a Russian launch vehicle.
Atlantis space shuttle docks with the Russian space station Mir for the first time.
A rocket carries the remains of 24 people into Earth orbit, in the first space burial.
The People's Republic of China launches the first Shenzhou spacecraft.
NEAR enters orbit around asteroid 433 Eros, the first spacecraft to orbit an asteroid.
Soyuz lifts off from carrying the first space tourist, American Dennis Tito.
Europe launches its first voyage to another planet, Mars.
Yuri Ivanovich Malenchenko became the first person to marry in space.
China launches Shenzhou 5, their first manned space mission.
SpaceShipOne becomes the first privately funded spaceplane to achieve spaceflight.
Iran launches its first satellite, sina 1, into space.
Iran opens its first space center and launches a rocket into space.
Space X (Private company): First stage booster first successful landing.
